input_text:
Job Title: Food Services - Meeting Preparation Coordinator

Location: Dallas, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Title & Specialty Area: Meeting Preparation Coordinator

Department: Food Services

Location: Dallas, TX

Shift: Full-Time

Job Type: On-Site

Why Children’s Health?

At Children's Health, our mission is to Make Life Better for Children, and we recognize that their health plays a crucial role in achieving this goal.

Through our cutting-edge treatments and affiliation with UT Southwestern, we strive to deliver an extraordinary patient and family experience, ensuring that every moment, big or small, contributes to their overall well-being.

Our dedication to promoting children's health extends beyond our organization and encompasses the broader community. Together, we can make a significant difference in the lives of children and contribute to a brighter and healthier future for all.

Summary

This position is responsible for meeting and conference room preparations for the facility. It has responsibility for ensuring the correct number of chairs, tables, and linens are properly set up for each meeting and/or conference.

Responsibilities

 Set up meeting/conference rooms according to specified instructions. Manage inventory of chairs, tables, and linen for meeting/ conference rooms. Requests work orders to repair broken tables and/or chairs. Provide catering/banquet support as needed. Clean meeting/ conference room prior to and after each event. Deliver floor stock to Pavilion, Trinity Towers and Chase Deliver hot and cold food items to Pavilion Café Drive company vehicles as needed Use approved customer service skills when interacting with patients, families, and external guests.

Work Experience

 At least 1 year banquet room set up experience (Preferred) At least 1 year experience in healthcare setting (Preferred)

EDUCATION

 High school diploma or equivalent (Required) Two-year Associate's degree or equivalent experience (Preferred)

LICENSES AND CERTIFICATIONS

 Texas Driver License (Required) Obtain Food Handlers Certification within 30 days of hire, and maintain current status thereafter (Required)

A Place Where You Belong

We put our people first. We welcome, value, and respect the beliefs, identities and experiences of our patients and colleagues. We are committed to delivering culturally effective care, creating meaningful partnerships in the communities we serve, and equipping and developing our team members to make Children’s Health a place where everyone can contribute.

Holistic Benefits – How We’ll Care For You

 Employee portion of medical plan premiums are covered after 3 years. 4%-10% employee savings plan match based on tenure Paid Parental Leave (up to 12 weeks) Caregiver Leave Adoption and surrogacy reimbursement >

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Meeting Preparation Coordinator
output_json.summary: Responsible for meeting and conference room preparations, managing inventory, and providing catering support.

Deliver floor stock to Pavilion, Trinity Towers and Chase.
Deliver hot and cold food items to Pavilion Café.
Use approved customer service skills when interacting with patients, families, and external guests.
